title: Dealing with the Dry | Agronomist Drew Penberthy

tasks.task: Organizing staff activities and decision-making during a drought
subtasks: Involving staff in decision making to keep morale high
Prioritizing staff infrastructure projects (fencing, soil works, erosion control)
Ensuring good water structures for future spraying when rainfall returns
Utilizing available funding for staff courses and training
Organizing staff study tours for knowledge sharing
Encouraging staff to take holidays and family time for mental health
Considering long-term effects of decisions on staff availability after drought
Providing alternative jobs for staff using farm equipment during the dry period
Addressing the impact of the drought on wives and family dynamics

tasks.task: Managing staff and family mental health during a drought
subtasks: Recognizing the stress staff and family members face during a drought
Encouraging work-life balance through holidays and family time
Supporting wives in the business who take on additional burdens during drought
Monitoring children's well-being and schooling when parents are stressed

tasks.task: Adapting farm operations during a drought
subtasks: Reducing workload on staff by focusing on infrastructure instead of farming tasks
Using farm equipment for non-farm-related jobs (contracting) to keep staff employed
Allocating staff to manage water structures and systems
Preparing contingency plans for staff reintegration after the drought ends
